quotes: in Procurement and Regulation in 1993.
Jean Tirole was born in August 1953 in Troyes, France,
gained engineering degrees at the École Polytechnique in Paris (1976)
École Nationale des Ponts et Chaussées (graduating in 1978 as a member of the elite Corps of Bridges, Waters and Forests,
a PhD in economics under Eric Maskin at MIT (1981).
as Professor of Economics from 1984-91.
He returned definitely to France in 1991
which he created in 2011.
He was president of the Econometric Society in 1998
of the European Economic Association in 2001.
the Yrjö Jahnsson prize of the European Economic Association in 1993,
the gold medal of the CNRS in 2007,
the inaugural winner of the BBVA Frontiers of Knowledge Awards in economics, finance and management in 2008.
He received the CME-MSRI award and the Levi-Strauss prize in 2010
the Ross prize in 2013.
In 2014 he received the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel
